thread.title: Rob Kardashian on Daughter Dream: ‘I Can’t Wait to Hear What My Baby’s Voice Sounds Like’
thread.title_full: Rob Kardashian on Daughter Dream: ‘I Can’t Wait to Hear What My Baby’s Voice Sounds Like’

title: Rob Kardashian on Daughter Dream: ‘I Can’t Wait to Hear What My Baby’s Voice Sounds Like’
text:
All of Dream Kardashian's Cutest Moments So Far 
“I can't wait to hear what my baby's voice sounds like,” tweeted the Arthur George sock designer, 30, who shares his little girl with Blac Chyna . “lol … I'm waiting.” 
Kardashian’s sweet confession comes nearly a week after he celebrated his 30th birthday on Friday, March 17. To ring in his special day, the E! personality shared a touching Instagram photo of Dream decked out in St. Patrick’s Day gear, calling her “the best gift of all!!” Rob Kardashian arrives for Blac Chyna's birthday celebration and the unveiling of her Chymoji emoji collection in 2016. Gabriel Olsen/WireImage 10 Times Rob Kardashian Sassed His Family 
"I feel like every person who's in a long-term relationship, or who is committed to their person, goes through ups and downs," the Lashed Bar entrepreneur told the magazine for its latest cover story. "Everything isn't always going to be peaches and cream. If it is, then it's fake. I'm in it for the long haul, so I feel like my advice [for anyone in a similar situation] is therapy, know each other's family, calling each other's moms." A post shared by ROBERT KARDASHIAN (@robkardashian) on Jan 10, 2017 at 3:34pm PST 
Chyna added that Dream serves as major motivation for the volatile couple to make their relationship work. A post shared by ROBERT KARDASHIAN (@robkardashian) on Mar 8, 2017 at 3:43pm PST 
"We're looking at the bigger picture," she told the publication. "We have a whole other human being that looks up to us, so we have to make sure she's taken care of. He's a wonderful dad. I think it's because he had such a great father," she added, referring to the late Robert Kardashian. Kardashian Family Album 
In the meantime, filming for season 2 of their E! reality series, Rob & Chyna , has been put on hold , as Us Weekly exclusively revealed earlier this month. "It was hard for them to film season 1, and season 2 is not happening," a source told Us . "They can't even get through a day together — logistically they can't do it. They coparent Dream, but they don't spend time together with Dream."
